intro: Licania krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii's licania, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
